name: Hotel Sari Konak

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well located - in the old part of Istanbul near the Blue Mosque, the Ayasofya, the Topkapi Palace and Sultanahmet Square (and tram). A former Ottoman home . . . rooms very clean, well appointed and tasteful. Front desk staff always most welcoming, helpful and knowledgeable . . . in particular Oktay and Mustafa. Lovely buffet breakfast on roof top terrace with view of the Blue Mosque. Plan to stay here again on our return trip next spring!
reviews.title: Lovely, immaculate hotel . . . walking distance to all the sights in Sultanhamet
A definite "stay here"!!!
reviews.text: What a wonderful location to stay for our first trip to Istanbul. The staff was wonderful, and the breakfast buffet every morning was great! The hotel helped us arrange tours, and the transport to and from the airport. We stayed in room #503. Very comfy and clean.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would stay here again!!!
reviews.title: So cute, nice people and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved the hotel. The decor was great and the rooftop was lovely. Breakfast every day was really good.
reviews.title: Quiet, comfortable, inviting

reviews.text: A few small things - at breakfast when we asked for prepared eggs (which weren't part of the buffet) we ended up being charged, which I wish they would have mentioned before checkout. Also, some of the wine seemed expensive.
reviews.title: Very nice and well located hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved the location and the building. The roof deck is better than you can imagine and the gentleman that runs it in the evening is very fun to talk to. Ask him about Turkish wines, as he is training to be a sommelier, which is somewhat rare in Turkey. The front desk guys were also very nice and helpful. They never seemed to rushed to answer our questions - and we had lots!
reviews.title: Absolutely excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have actually stayed here twice. Once in room 301, which is the basic room and was fine but not huge. We would be happy to stay there again, especially since we spent very little time in the room and did not need much space. The second time we used a free upgrade coupon and got room 305, which is a deluxe and had about 50% more room and a cute little balcony facing the street.
reviews.title: Significant street noise in the morning was very disruptive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was good but we were very disappointed in our room because it was slightly below street level and the vendors outside our window began working about 6 am every morning. We had stayed at another hotel in Istanbul the previous year and much preferred it. Reservations at that hotel were not available when we booked our room.
reviews.title: Just the boutique hotel in Istanbul I was looking for!

reviews.text: My husband and I were extremely satisfied with the 5 nights we spent at the Sari Konak hotel in Istanbul (Sultanahmet area). And I'm pretty sure the hotel is consistently awesome--we stayed here twice (3 nights at the beginning of our trip, 2 nights at the end, with a friend's wedding in between).
reviews.title: Great Little Hotel

reviews.text: Location and pictures of the hotel's rooftop terrace on the website sold us on the place--and both turned out to be better than we imagined! The terrace had stunning views of the Blue Mosque, Haghia Sophia and the Asian side across the Marmara Sea.
reviews.title: Nice Boutique Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perfectly located for walking to the main Byzantine and Ottoman sites, as well as to the Bazaar. Our room was not large but very well appointed. The small nook with a bench is perfect for storing luggage (under) and travel brochures, purses, etc. (on the bench) without intruding into the room. The bathroom was modern and the room air conditioner was easily controlled by a remote. The staff was very helpful, and the roof garden was fabulous. In the evening, the illuminated Blue Mosque is right there, and during the day a view in the other direction gives you the ship traffic heading into and out of the Bosphorus. But the star of the roof garden is Hassan, who is a mine of information about the excellent Turkish wines as well as what to see. Hassan has just about completed the work for his sommelier's license, but for the sake of future patrons I hope he stays on at the Sari Konak. The hotel is located in a lively restaurant area, so there is no need to go far for a meal.
reviews.title: A Perfect Choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent the last week of our 6 week honeymoon in Istanbul at the Sari Konak. First, it is in an absolute perfect location for visiting Blue Mosque, the Cisterns, restaurants, and shopping. The breakfast was absolutely memorable; figs, yogurt, eggs, fresh fruit, coffee, tea, and much more. The customer service was fantastic. We even had the owner come to our breakfast table and chat with us, friendly and genuine. Our room was so comfortable, clean, and cute that I took photos of the decorations in hopes of remodeling in a similar fashion one day. I've recommended this B&B to two different parties traveling to Istanbul recently. Thanks for the perfect conclusion to our honeymoon!!
reviews.title: Wonderful, Relaxing, Amazing

reviews.text: The staff at this hotel greets you with a cold drink in the "living room" and a personal welcome complete with maps and recommendations. The rooms are spotless and the bowl of turkish delight candy adds a tasty touch. The hotel is perfectly located and the staff is warm and gracious. You feel as if you are staying in someone's well-appointed home.
reviews.title: Spotless and Welcoming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Sari Konak as the last stop on our honeymoon in Turkey, and we just absolutely loved this hotel. The location can't be beat, the views from the rooftop deck are fantastic, and the service staff is incredibly warm and helpful!
reviews.title: Great hotel! Fantastic location!

reviews.text: The room itself was a good size, which from what I've heard isn't so easy to come by when staying in Sultanahmet, and the bathroom was very clean and nicely equipped. We also had a small balcony overlooking the cobblestone street out front, that made for some nice people watching before bed in the evening. When we arrived we were greeted by a friendly face at the front desk, who we ended up seeing there throughout most of our stay. He gave us a lay of the land, suggested some local attractions for us to visit and, to our great relief, provided us with two plug converters to use during our stay, after we had mistakenly left ours at our previous hotel.
reviews.title: Sari Konal Oteli - Istanbul - a great place to stay in Istanbul

reviews.text: Staying in this beautifully restored old mansion in an extraordinary area of Sultanahmet between the Blue Mosque and the Marmara Sea was an experience which will stay with us forever. We spent our first night in one of the spacious suites & it was wonderful! To have breakfast or pre-dinner drinks on the rooftop terrace with the Blue Mosque right there was truly breathtaking. Wonderful staff who provided a wealth of local knowledge & excellent service. This area of Istanbul is only minutes away from the hustle & bustle & the throngs of tourists but offers a completely different experience of this remarkable city.
reviews.title: A place of exceptional beauty

reviews.text: Loved this boutique hotel! Stayed in a beautiful suite with my husband, newborn and mother in law. The staff provides great service, arranged crib for the baby, booked a Turkish bath for us and give you a great map and orientation to the area at check in. Lovely room and hotel in an awesome neighborhood. You can walk to great shops and restaurants right outside the door of the hotel, but still quiet neighborhood that is walking distance from the Arasta Bazaar, public transport and Grand Bazaar, along with Blue Mosque. Very good breakfast with good variety of food. Good views from the rooftop where you could lounge.
reviews.title: Great experience!

reviews.text: Besides not accommodating one extra person for one night, everything was perfect.
reviews.title: A Must Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were SO CLEAN! The beds were relatively comfortable for Turkey i.e. it felt like there was a little padding instead of sleeping on lumpy bricks. The breakfast was fresh and tasty and the terrace was beautiful.
reviews.title: Happy Again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second stay at the Hotel Sari Konak. Once again we thoroughly enjoyed this hotel with its excellent personnel who make you feel most welcom. It is perfectly situated with wonderful views from the breakfast terrace. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Location Comfortable Hotel

description: Hotel Sari Konak, set in the historic district of Sultanahmet, is a small family owned hotel, taking pride in offering its guests a charming "home away from home" in Istanbul, with many guests returning on a regular basis. The traveller who feels lost in a big hotel can experience the comfort and pleasure of home in such a small scale hotel where guests can establish friendships outside the boundaries of the classic customer relationship.
